Some reactions, somewhat at random...

Actually, I think that lurking in [Nodes to Consider] and copying what you see is a primary source for poor consideration choices, in part because poor considerations hang around for days before someone verifies that the vote isn't going anywhere and unconsiders.

I've been meaning to update [Nodes to Consider] to include some text to alert people to this situation.

I don't think "a question that has been asked before, it probably should not be considered a duplicate" is not strong enough. Even if someone is posting the same question over and over, they shouldn't be consider *as a duplicate*. Consider it as "previously asked and answered at [id://...]". Or consider the previous asking of it to moved to be a reply to the new version.

Use [id://...] when linking to the duplicate node in the consideration reason. That way (after some code gets deployed into production) you can see if the other node has had "(DUPLICATE)" added to its title, or if it has been nuked (perhaps we should have reaping updated a node to add "REAPED:" or something).

I find "Delete a personal attack" to be a poor reason for consideration. Some day we'll have an appropriate consideration for such unpleasant nodes. For now, the best solution is not consideration: ignore it, downvote it, /msg the author, or (if you have unusually high maturity and eloquence) reply to it.

Now that people can edit their own root nodes, it doesn't make sense for people to request editors to fix their typos (since Anonymous Monk can't consider nor prove s/he is the author).
